sentences.english: As the police moved in, the hostages were running out, he said.
sentences.chinese: 隨着警方進入該區域，人質也都四散跑出。

sentences.english: This list looks at 10 modern examples of hostage taking.
sentences.chinese: 這份目錄選出10大現代人質挾持編列成表。

sentences.english: Haudio-videoe you remarketing the study concerning the rescue of the hostaging?
sentences.chinese: 你看了關於救助人質的文章了嗎？

sentences.english: Chinese policeman tries to convince a knife-wielding man to release a hostage on a street in Guangzhou, China.
sentences.chinese: 警察試圖說服揮舞刀具的男子釋放人質。

sentences.english: At this point, he threatened to kill a hostage.
sentences.chinese: 在這個節骨眼上，他威脅殺死人質。

sentences.english: A Bocchicchio hostage was gilt - edged insurance.
sentences.chinese: 因此，一個卜啓丘人質就等於最把穩的保證。

sentences.english: She talked composedly to reporters about her terrible ordeal.
sentences.chinese: 個個人質都經歷了可怕的折磨。

sentences.english: Of course, each round will be faced with a huge upside-taking and release of pressure .
sentences.chinese: 當然，每一輪將面臨一個巨大的倒人質和壓力釋放。

sentences.english: Haudio-videoe you read the written content in regards to the rescue of the hostage?
sentences.chinese: 你看了關於救助人質的文章了嗎？

sentences.english: It was unclear what his relation to the hostage-taker was.
sentences.chinese: 目前還不清楚他和劫持人質者有什麼關係。

sentences.english: The seizure of American hostages in Iran sharpened the pain of national humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗扣押美國人質的行動加劇了國恥的痛苦。

sentences.english: The five hostages, the Holtzbergs among them, were dead.
sentences.chinese: 包括霍爾茨伯格在內的五名人質已經死亡。

sentences.english: There is no use having good laws if nobody enforces them.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有人質法，有好的法律又有何用。

sentences.english: The robber decided to abduct a hostage.
sentences.chinese: 強盜決定綁架一名人質。

sentences.english: She had asked Ser Barristan that question the afternoon the hostages went forth.
sentences.chinese: 送走人質當天下午她曾問過巴利斯坦爵士。

sentences.english: The children were detained as hostage in the underground.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們被扣押在地下通道里作人質。

definition: to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
